qas.question: When was the General Anaya borough officially merged into Mexico City?
How man boroughs was the borough of Mexico City split into in 1970?
How many districts does the federal government control in 1970?
Which boroughs was the Mexico City borough split into?

answers.text: Cuauhtémoc, Miguel Hidalgo, Venustiano Carranza and Benito Juárez

context: In <a0_0>1941<a0_0/>, the General Anaya borough was merged to the Central Department, which was then renamed "Mexico City" (thus reviving the name, but not the autonomous municipality). From 1941 to 1970, the Federal District comprised twelve delegaciones and Mexico City. In 1970 Mexico City was split into <a1_0>four<a1_0/> different delegaciones: <a3_0>Cuauhtémoc, Miguel Hidalgo, Venustiano Carranza and Benito Juárez<a3_0/>, increasing the number of delegaciones to <a2_0>sixteen<a2_0/>. Since then, in a de facto manner, the whole Federal District, whose delegaciones had by then almost formed a single urban area, began to be considered a synonym of Mexico City.
